info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 2:05AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Blaine and Hill Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Minor flooding is occuring and is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:25 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.81 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.4 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lodge Creek International Borde 7.0 5.0 Sun 1 am MDT 7.9 7.8 9.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM MDT.
